Boston.com
10

Middlesex DA Leone says he won't seek reelection

Gerry Leone, the Middlesex district attorney since 2006, told his staff that he would not seek reelection in 2014 and that he would not seek elective office. (Boston Globe)
  • Middlesex DA's office Leone's bio

Patrick seeks to cut retiree health costs

Most future state and municipal retirees will have to pay about $1,000 a year more for health care under an ambitious proposal from Governor Patrick. (Boston Globe)
  • 11/15/12 Insurers told to lower health costs for retirees

Celebrities invade CES in Las Vegas

A number of big names were in the crowd at the annual International Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas, including Tim Tebow, Ke$ha, and Danny Devito.

Shaw's, Star Market part of $3.3b sale

The struggling parent of the Shaw’s and Star Market chain of roughly 170 store said today that it has agreed to sell several of its supermarket chains. (Boston Globe)
  • Watch Big Story: Shaw's, Star Market part of purchase
  • Rating local supermarkets  |  Survey Where do you buy?

45,000 Bostonians getting flu robocalls

City health officials are urging people to contact their primary care doctor to get a vaccination. (Boston Globe)
  • With flu concerns, priests may forgo Communion wine
  • Where to get a flu shot | Vaccine shortage in Somerville
  • Health answers: Can the flu vaccine make you feel sick?

Boston diocese begins its reorganization

The Archdiocese of Boston announced the names of more than two dozen parishes participating in the first phase of a major reorganization. (Boston Globe)
  • List of parishes that will be grouped into clusters

News

Bombings kill dozens in Pakistan

A series of bombings in different parts of Pakistan killed 103 people on Thursday, including 69 who died in a sectarian attack on a bustling billiard hall in the southwest city of Quetta, officials said.
